title: vegan eating in portland, oregon
name: vegan eating in portland, oregon
description:
A Map by Shilo

places a vegan can get something to eat in portland. be it slice of pizza, fancy dinner, greasy bar food, or a bag of fake jerky.

properties.name: Food Fight!
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle  4179 SE Division, Portland, Oregon 97202Vegan Grocery

properties.name: Loveland
properties.description: Posted by Paiges 320 Se 2nd Ave Portland Or 97214Huge all ages venue that is perpetually struggling. Great place to see shows though--one smaller venue upstairs, Huge on on ground floor. There used to be a cool vegan cafe here that made meatball subs and stuff. Weird right?! Local, touring and festivals abound!

properties.name: Paradox Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Paiges   Vegan Pdxvegan and vegetarian food. owned by Jimbo the same guy that runs the Vita on Alberta. Paradox is kinds like Vita\'s kid brother that everyone ignores. Paradox food simply isnt as good or as cared for as the Vita\'s. Rumor has it the staff is treated better at Vita too. maybe there is a correlation. If you are going to Paradox be prepared for a long wait. The service is always sloooow. But the Servers are friendly and cute. Eat the corn cakes, multi-grain pancakes and soups, burritos and fancy cakes. Avoid the rotating menus, frankly i cant tell if they even taste half of the stuff they advertise before it goes o the menu. Trust me I love this restaurant...I just feel sorry for it is all.

properties.name: Pizza a go go
properties.description: Posted by Shilo   3420 N williams ave portland orPizza a go go is a pizzaria with beer and a patio. has vegan slices all the time.

properties.name: Red & Black Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Deisnor      2138 Southeast Division Street, Portland, OR, 97202Cafe & music co-op

properties.name: Tube
properties.description: Posted by Shilo  18 3rd ave sw, portland orTube is a bar. they serve drinks and food. much of the food is vegan, and all of it is delicious. [somehwat expensive but worth it] they can also make many dairy cocktails [white russian etc.] vegan as well. they have DJs most nights and sometimes bands will play there. it is very small, the walls are green molded plastic, and the folks who run the joint are total gems.

properties.name: Valentine's
properties.description: Posted by Shilo    232 Southwest Ankeny Street, Portland, OR, 97204cafe, art, and music space

properties.name: Vita Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Deisnor   3024 Ne Alberta St, Portland, ORVegan, dog-friendly, kid-friendly dining

properties.name: Voodoo Doughnuts
properties.description: Posted by Pinkshoelaces   22 SW 3rd Ave, portland, orBest doughnut place ever. Open late (until like 4am). First lost my Voodoo Doughnut virginity: Drunk on my 22nd birthday, a bunch of friends and I went there. They have doughnuts like the following: The Cock and Balls (a doughnut shaped like, well, a cock and balls; naturally, it\'s cream-filled), The Mango Tango, a captain crunch covered doughnut, a peanut butter oreo doughnut, etc.
